3-ring binder
3-hole, tabbed dividers

4 one-subject notebooks
Highlighters

Book covers

Clorox wipes

Miss Wood:
large 3 ring binder for all classes
physics needs a TI-84
Mr. Linquist:
Algebra 1 and 2, Geometry, General Applied, Trig and Calc need a composition notebook, loose leaf paper, pencils, colored pens.
Algebra 1/ geometry: graphing calculator recommended.
Algebra 2/ trig and calc: graphing calculator needed

Chinook Schools is in search of substitute teachers for the upcoming school year! We need them for all grades and all subjects. Did you know that you don't need a degree to be a sub? We would also like to congratulate Frank Billmayer, Mitzi Cecrle, and Shane Stroebe on joining the Board of Trustees. A big thanks is also in order to Scott Gunderson, Ernie Johnson, and Justin Simenson for the time and effort they gave to our Board of Trustees.

Chinook Public Schools will hold Senior Graduation on May 17th at 8 pm at the Fairgrounds. All attendees should be in their parking spaces BY 8:00 pm. Space will be limited.

Due to Covid-19 Chinook Schools will not hold 8th grade graduation.

Chinook Schools will not serve meals on May 22nd. We would like to announce that Chinook will have a summer lunch program starting June 1st. We will have a grab and go meal program at the Meadowlark Elementary School. More details will be released at a later date.

Tonight’s football game had the Shelby Coyotes hosting the Chinook Sugarbeeters. In the second half, Shelby’s quarterback, Tanner Parsons, went down with an injury. He sat on the bench for the rest of the game, unable to return. Shelby still went on to win the game 25-12 with Tyler Larson taking over the QB spot. At the end of the game both teams went to the center of the field for the mandatory handshakes. Afterwards, remarkably, the entire Chinook football team came across the field to the bench where Tanner Parsons was sitting. In a display of great sportsmanship, each player and the Chinook coaching staff went and shook his hand and wished him the best. In closing, I just have to say that it’s still a great day to be a Shelby Coyote, but hats off to the Chinook Sugarbeeters for being a total class act.
